comments.body: So I like the positioning of this, but it makes it seem required, which is not something we have agreed on. Could we maybe add a one line comment above the `license_family` that notes this is an optional field?

Sorry, I misunderstood https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/pull/1838#discussion_r85647035 . I included a comment, but I'm still not sure if it's correct. Is it always optional or just if it's identical to `license`?

No worries. `license_family` is optional, but encouraged. However, there has been a strong push a couple of times to make it required. So at least showing it in the `example` with an optional note is some level of compromise.

  license_family: MIT

  # (even if the license doesn't require it) using the license_file entry.

comments.body: do you need to add a `name.replace("-", "_")` here, or whatever the equivalent is in jinja syntax?

Hmm...I thought about this and recently went the wrong way. In particular, I thought `lazy-object-proxy` should have been (or was intended to be) `lazy_object_proxy` and found out that it is not the case. There may be other examples.
Oh yeah you're totally right. I was thinking of the problem where the package name is `lazy-object-proxy` but what you want to import is `lazy_import_proxy`.
Do we want to start templating the name too? I've found this handy in a few cases and other people seem to have picked up on it. Though this suggestion may be out of scope for this proposal.
See this [example](https://github.com/conda-forge/funcsigs-feedstock/blob/f896b21228dd6dcaa74c2c60cad9b3f1b4648ebb/recipe/meta.yaml) to get an idea of what I mean.
My leaning is keep the sample a little simpler, but I'm hoping to add another example today too.

comments.body: I would add a comment and say: `If this is the first release of the package, make sure the build number is 0`

I don't want to add too much text here. Hopefully it is clear enough that recipes must be build `0` when entering staged-recipes. (Otherwise we won't merge it anyways as it already exists as a feedstock :wink:)
Yes but it could be a release of a package that exists in `defaults`.
Ideally we should still recommend `0` and keep trying to improve conda to support channel preferences, etc.

comments.body: Maybe add a note about adding people's interests to the guidelines issue ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/139 ) so we don't spam them by checking all the time.
@jakirkham we should wikify #139 and add a link to it here.

We added it to the [docs](https://github.com/conda-forge/conda-forge.github.io/blob/master/docs/guidelines.md). I prefer docs for this than the wiki.

The only point I'm mentioning about ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/139 ) is this clause.

> If they specify they only want to be contacted for certain recipes or none at all, please respect their wishes also add here what recipes (if any) they would like to be notified for. If they are no longer interested in any conda recipes, make that note here as well. Before contacting anyone please consult the list below to see if that contributor has restrictions.

So, all I'm saying, is if people complain about over pinging on recipes we should note their preferences listed there.

Also, issue ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/139 ) is a [doc](http://conda-forge.readthedocs.io/en/latest/guidelines.html) now. Though issue ( https://github.com/conda-forge/staged-recipes/issues/139 ) is still good for listing maintainer preferences.
